problem_prompt:
Your job is to solve a number theory problem. The problem was revealed one sentence at a time. You are on the last sentence have the entire problem now. The following is as much of the problem you have revealed, and the work done so far. There may be errors in the work done so far, so fix them if necessary.
Suppose $77\cdot 88\cdot 99 \equiv n\pmod{20}$, where $0\le n<20$.What is the value of $n$?
Since $77 \equiv 17 \pmod{20}$, $88 \equiv 8 \pmod{20}$, and $99 \equiv 19 \pmod{20}$, we have the congruence $17\cdot 8\cdot 19 \equiv n\pmod{20}$. 

Calculating $17\cdot 8\cdot 19 \equiv 2588 \equiv 8 \pmod{20}$, we have found that $n=8$ in the given congruence $77\cdot 88\cdot 99 \equiv n\pmod{20}$. 

Now, determine the value of $n$ in the given congruence $3 \cdot 7 \cdot 14 \cdot 15 \cdot 16 \cdot 17 \cdot 18 \equiv n \pmod{20}$.
gpt_response:
We have that $3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot 15\cdot 16\cdot 17\cdot 18 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot(15\cdot 16)\cdot(17\cdot 18) \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot 12\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot 2\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 8\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 8\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 8\cdot 6 \equiv 504 \equiv 4\pmod{20}$. 

Therefore, the value of $n$ in the given congruence is $\boxed{4}$.
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response 4?: We have that $3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot 15\cdot 16\cdot 17\cdot 18 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot(15\cdot 16)\cdot(17\cdot 18) \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot 12\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 14\cdot 2\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 8\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 8\cdot 6 \equiv 3\cdot 7\cdot 8\cdot 6 \equiv 504 \equiv 4\pmod{20}$. 

Therefore, the value of $n$ in the given congruence is $\boxed{4}$.
